description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ojf6","text":"Workflow for data integrity and quality control of high throughput sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq6000. The analyses are performed on macOS Monterey 12.3.1 running on an ARM-architected Apple Silicon processor. This workflow considers that the user directory (~/) is structured as seen in the \"work environment configuration\" protocol. To avoid error messages, please follow this protocol and set up your computer before starting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer:

status.info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ihmc","text":"Activate the previously created QC_env environment by typing the following command in the terminal :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eefoo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fie4j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10343,"name":"conda activate QC_env","os_name":"","os_version":"","command_name":"","description":"","can_edit":1,"guid":"8D66AD20D12E11ECAE82F7BA206B645D"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fheul","text":"Considering that the .gz archive downloaded from the GIGA servers has been unzipped under ~/fastq_files, that the original_md5.txt file has been stored under ~/md5 and that the python \u0026 R scripts previously created are stored under ~/KE_utilities, type the following command in the terminal to recompute the md5 hash and store it in a new file under ~/md5","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfrd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fm6pc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10344,"name":"md5 ~/fastq_files/* \u003e ~/md5/recomputed_md5.txt","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"EA7384B0D12F11ECAE82F7BA206B645D"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2mm42","text":"After generating the ~/md5/recomputed_md5.txt file, type the following command in the terminal to launch the python script that allows the data integrity check :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80gl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"clpp7","text":"This script can be downloaded on GitHub : https://github.com/elmoussaoui-k/drylab_workflow/blob/b41c0a03d7a3fdb023a94b331cab5460d706b6c8/data_integrity_checker.py","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":42,"length":120}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10345,"name":"python3 ~/KE_utilities/data_integrity_checker.py","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"073979E0D13211ECAE82F7BA206B645D"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D9619670D14511ECA5680A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/elmoussaoui-k/drylab_workflow/blob/b41c0a03d7a3fdb023a94b331cab5460d706b6c8/data_integrity_checker.py"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"kba7","text":"Specify the path to the original_md5.txt file and then to the recomputed_md5.txt file :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbd8t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ffi4s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10346,"name":"*************** DATA INTEGRITY CHECKER ***************

Please enter the path to original_md5.txt : /users/khalid/md5/original_md5.txt
Please enter the path to recomputed_md5.txt : /users/khalid/md5/recomputed_md5.txt

------------------------------------------------------","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"77CA2830D13211ECAE82F7BA206B645D"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e3kej","text":"Start the fastQC analysis on all existing files in the ~/fastq_files directory in recursive mode using \"*\". Moreover, the addition of the --outdir option allows to specify an output directory for the reports generated by fastQC. This generates an individual .html report for each file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3scs3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"39srp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10347,"name":"fastqc ~/fastq_files/* --outdir ~/fastqc_reports/","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":"fastqc version : v. 0.11.9","can_edit":1,"guid":"CE6B5180D13E11ECAE82F7BA206B645D"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6lf3a","text":"To summarize the reports generated with fastQC into a single report, run multiQC. To do this, type the following command in the terminal :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kv3v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6t8f0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10348,"name":"multiqc ~/fastqc_reports --outdir ~/multiqc_report","os_name":"","os_version":"","command_name":"","description":"multiqc version : v. 1.12","can_edit":1,"guid":"AC09FA90D14011ECAE82F7BA206B645D"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"s7fq","text":"The reads can be filtered automatically with fastp. Just launch the program, specify the 2 .fastq.gz files (R1 and R2) as input and specify the name and location of the 2 processed files. Adding the -h option allows to specify a folder for the HTML report. The option -j " " allows to cancel the creation of the JSON report. The -R option allows to give a name to the generated HTML report.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"btdhd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dcfng","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10349,"name":"fastp -i ~/fastq_files/KE0xx_R1.fastq.gz 
-I ~/fastq_files/KE0xx_R2.fastq.gz 
-o ~/fastp/cleaned_fastq_files/KE0xx_R1_clean.fastq.gz 
-O ~/fastp/cleaned_fastq_files/KE0xx_R2_clean.fastq.gz 
-h ~/fastp/fastp_reports/KE0xx_fastp_report.html 
-j "" 
-R "Fastp report : KE0xx"","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":"fastp version : v. 0.23.2","can_edit":1,"guid":"A3C97B60D14211ECAE82F7BA206B645D"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6oqn4","text":"The generated reports can be opened by typing the following command in the terminal :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cq5p1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5t256","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10350,"name":"open ~/fastqc_reports/KE0xx_R1_fastqc.html","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"FAC9E740D14411ECAE82F7BA206B645D"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"jftf","text":"The generated report can be opened by typing the following command in the terminal :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57g3e","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5lgnb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10351,"name":"open ~/multiqc_report/multiqc_report.html","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"","description":null,"can_edit":1,"guid":"3C6D7E00D14511ECAE82F7BA206B645D"}}}}

title: Bioinformatic workflow for NGS data control
